intro: Cryptantha angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Cryptantha angustifolia is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained conditions.
